intro: Calonemorchis ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty calonemorchis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are upright and branching. Calonemorchis ferruginea is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate dry conditions.
